subject: Creativity
title: The Innovator's Dilemma: Why Success Breeds Failure
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Innovator's Dilemma: Why Success Breeds Failure.

hook.text: Kodak invented the digital camera in 1975 â€” then buried it to protect film profits. They filed for bankruptcy in 2012.

buildup.text: The Innovator's Dilemma: successful companies can't adopt disruptive innovations because doing so would cannibalize.

discovery.text: Kodak's rational choice was to protect film. Film was 70% margin. Digital was 5%.

twist.text: Nokia, Blackberry, Blockbuster, and Sears all made the same rational mistake.

climax.text: The solution: create separate units for disruptive innovation with different metrics, leadership, and culture.

punchline.text: The safest choice is often the most dangerous one. Just ask Kodak.

quiz.question: Why did Kodak suppress its own digital camera invention?
options: Protecting profitable film business (70% margins vs 5% digital)
